intro: Medicosma verticillata, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems that are often hairy and bear clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are arranged in whorls along the stems. This plant is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Asclepias, to which it belongs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
